meanings.sent1: In the past, people used a soldo to buy things in Italy.
meanings.sent2: The soldo was a type of money that Italians used long ago.
meanings.sent3: Why did the old man keep a soldo in his pocket as a lucky charm?
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare as finding a soldo on the street.
meanings.sent5: The soldo gleamed in the sunlight, a piece of history in her hand.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Portugal and Brazil
meanings.sent1: I need to exchange my dollars for soldo before my trip to Brazil.
meanings.sent2: The soldo is the money used in Portugal and Brazil for everyday purchases.
meanings.sent3: The parrot squawked loudly when it saw the shiny soldo on the table.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was worth more than all the soldo in the world.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh coffee filled the air as she counted her soldo for the day.
